reviewText:
I went into this game with an open mind, but keeping in mind how other titles have already set the bar on these kind of games.
Sadly, I was disappointed very fast. My remarks from less than 30 minutes of playing:

- Camera behaves very strange. It is ok in vehicles, but very sluggish and laggy on foot.
- Tractor behavior is very strange. Tractors accelerate too fast, and stop too slowly. Carrying heavy equipment makes no difference at all in behavior. I have never seen any farmer plow their field at 30+ km/h. Suspension" on the rear axle makes steering in small places tricky.
- A lot of often used UI elements are slow to get to. I.E. big map is only accessible through main menu.
- Surprising lack of content. Only a few tractors
date: trailers and equipment available in the shop. As far as I can tell
recommended:
only one map.
- The map is split into several parts with a loading screen between. Is this necessary in 2017? Fields separate from "main farm".
- Engine sounds are very bland.

On the positive side:
- Large
hoursPlayed: diverse and well decorated maps.\n- Ground feels realistic
voteText: uneven in the fields and smooth roads.\n\nThere might be some enjoyment in this game for some people
helpfulPercent: but it is sadly asking too much money for too little."
commentsCount: 125 of 152 people (82%) found this review helpful 10 people found this review funny

reviewText:
I don't want to waste a lot of time reviewing this turd, but here goes.

I'd call myself a veteran of Farming Sim Games.  I've had several YouTube series on Giants Software's Farming Simulator 2013 and 15 series, as well as Professional Farmer 2014 and Farm Expert 2015.

Professional Farmer 2017 feels like it should be a predecessor to Professional Farmer 2014 and feels like it should have come out in 2008, not 2016.  Honestly, how can you make a farming game that is actually worse than Professional Farmer 2014??  I mean, come on?  I slightly enjoyed Pro Farmer 2014, but 2017 is an embarassment.

I'm going to play a bit longer, but right now I can't see a light at the end of the tunnel which will make this game likable.

If you are expecting an experience equal to or better than Farming Simulator 2013 or Farming Simulator 15 but from a different company, THIS GAME IS NOT IT!

As a YouTuber and as your friend, I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS GAME IN ANY WAY AT THIS TIME!

Spend your money on something better.

reviewText:
This is copy and paste from a thread I started when the game came out.
***update****Played an additional 35 minutes***
Just posting my notes,
5 crops wheat,rye,canola,barley,corn and grass for animals.
Has farmhands but you can't see them work.
An astonishing lack of usable equipment.
Mirror reflection" is not a reflection and is so bad you kinda wish it was just left blank.
Certain ground textures are really really bad and repetative. Like the one used for some dirt roads.
Sound levels and some sounds themselves are bad.
It's looking more like this is gonna get returned and I would drop the rating to 4 out of 10 and now gonna give it a thumbs down as it just has no "staying" power. Not much in the game that makes you want to stay with it.
***end update***

If any of you hang out in the farm simulator forums of the various farm games over the years you may recognize my name. If not
date: thats probably better for you but UIG knows me. Me and UIG have a past. The long and short of it is I dislike them. The type of dislike and mistrust you have in a 3rd cousin that always comes around and steals from your grandmother type of dislike.\nI created a steam group called Caveat Emptor with the sole purpose of warning people of games like UIG publishes. We lobbied players for several games warning them of the various problems they could face when buying from these German publishers. Ag Sim
recommended:
Pro Farm ect . if it sucked we were on it. Thankfully steam ended up making a review system so we disbanded.

Today is a different time though in the steam world. We now not only have a review system we also have a product return system.

I see alot of people not wanting to take the plunge so in a few minutes I will purchase and play the game for 60 minutes
hoursPlayed:
putting me well within the 2 hour time limit for returns and giving me enough time to at least check for a broken game. Stay tuned I will post my results to the end of this post.

Ok exactly 59 minutes of playing later......
First my specs
voteText: Win10 I7 3.6 with 12 gb ram
helpfulPercent: nvidia 760ti with 2gb ram.\nSettings used: everything max even the stuff I hate. 1600X900 resolution. FPS was locked at 58 for the entire play through.\nWhat I did: I went through the tutorial. Explored settings
votesHelpful: tried to make stuff break.\nWhat I found:\nWell the game start and runs. but so did the last pro farm 2014. So that really isn't saying much hehe. From a technical side it wouldn't break or get it to break ie crashes ect. So technically the game is not broken
votesTotal: it works and is completely playable and seems to be for the most part error free
votesFunny:
although NOT glitch free.
That is as far as I will go from the buyer beware point of view. Reviewing the game is subjective and I personally think those two things should be seperate ( if a game works/not and if it fun).

From a review perspective going through the tutorial introduced me to the basics of farming and animal upkeep in the game. It took about 35-40 minutes to go through with me stopping during various tasks to take notice of glitches ect. (the other 19 minutes of my play time was devoted to trying to technically crash the game).

The game plays simuliar to pro farm 14 and has touches of ag sim in it as well I believe. It incorporates the animals into the farming side for the production of slurry and the animals aparently mate and breed providing they are taken cared of. During the tutorial there were a few odds and ends like the tut telling you to press the d-pad up but you end up needing to press it down. Also you run across some agravating things like not being able to unhook your last piece of equipment for the next on in the tutorial unless you un-hook it right in front of the next item you need. So then you have to push the old equipment out of the way with your tractor.

From a simulation perspective
commentsCount: the game simulates insects and weeds apparently (did not experience that personally) you also have to monitor water levels (humidity) so compared to its competitor ( FS by Giants) it is a bit more complex but easy to manage as the interface is pretty strait foward. The fields are pretty small in comparision though and the field itself looks like a bandaid on the earth as it is a raised patch above ground level.\n\nI would imagine this is to accomodate the deformable terrain and make lag managable which I think was the other games achilles because the whole map was deformable and this has got to cause an issue but i am no programmer. So although it looks like crap
column16: it makes the deformable terrain possible and managable fps wise. Is it worth the trade off?? Well I found myself thinking it was worth the trade off anytime I was in the middle of a field but anytime driving next to the edge I was instantly annoyed (the tractor sometimes catches this edge) and driving up on a field
column17: well it just like poo so was it worth the trade-off?? yes and no.\n\nSo the field and farm sim seems ok but what about equipment simulation? Now I for one could care less about equipment licenses and driving the "official" tatra or whatever. So I won't makr it down for that although some others may. But the vehicles are just like other farm games from them and other non -Giants companies. They lack simulation especially the most important vehicles in the game
column18: the tractor and the combine. For starters once again the vehicles have this wierd suspension that seems to be based in the center of the vehicle. So your tractor tires do not move up and down but the tractor rocks back and forth. its kinda like being in a small boat. The suspension is also way overdone as far as bouncing around goes. I feel like I am in my teen age years lincoln continental which had really bad shocks and would rock for 30 secons after hitting a bump in the road.\n\nThe turn radius on the tractors is also lacking but maybe that just the "feel" and maybe the radii are correct for ech vehicle. The harvesters dont have visible grain tank (least not the one in tutorial). Trailer hitches are on a single horizontal plane and have no ability to move oon a verticle axis. So when you go over bumbs any trailer will lift up. For instance
column19: go over the little rise from the pavement as you go from dirt to road at an angle and one side of your trailer tires will be off the ground at certain moments. Weight seems to have no effect. Terrain no effect. You can plow and max speed for instance. So simulation wise the equipment is the worst part of this game.\n\nWill I keep the game....well i have another 40 minutes of "safe" time to explore the game still so I might at least do that
column20: keeping it....not so sure.\n\nWhile giants does need to worry about the "other" farm game coming out later this year I don't think they need to worry about this title all that much
column21: other than the fact they ( giants ) better get thier poopies together or face extinction because real compitition is not far away and frankly this title
column22: if they could fix the vehicles could be part of that compitition.\n\nI will post this all in the review section and I am going to
column23: for the time being give it a thumbs up. Because 1) it aint broke
column24: 2) at the price it does at least meet the value imho\nIf I were to grade it though it would be a 5 out of 10.\nI may revisit my thumbs up at a later date."

reviewText:
A Modern Farming Simulatorhttps://youtu.be/Z9oNAZ5PfCk
+ Easily playable with a gamepad
+ Controls are easy to understand (no overly complicated simulator nonsense)
+ Great tutorial that teaches you everything you need to know in around 20mins or less
+ Very nice environments with some pretty nice graphics for a simulator
+ The farming itself although repetitive, can be quite relaxing and generally realistic
+ A very surprising soundtrack with a few pretty epic songs
+ You can manage pigs, chickens, cows, and sheep
+ Large open world, 4 areas in total
+ You can purchase better equipment, vehicles, and crops

- The game feels a bit lifeless without other NPC characters in the world
- The main game is extremely slow paced, and if you don't want to torture yourself you need to position equipment in a way so you can easily teleport between them without having to drive long distances.
- It seems to be missing a plot or any real goal, I feel like this game would be much better if it had an overall objective or some sort of reward for all of your hard-work.

reviewText:
Professional Farmer Simulator is like the name says a simulator with a farming setting. So if you liked all the other Farming Simulators from the last years then you also will like this one. In the game it self you play as a farmer and build your farm. You can actually raise cow, chickens and everything else farmers do.
The game has  pretty amazing soundtracks, some of them are country style and there is actually some kind of epic one ;P You would think it doesn't fit, but it actually makes you feel amazing when you farming :D
The map also is huge and is a open world with 4 areas. Everything else is what you expect from a good Simulator.
And also some of the bugs people report on, seem to have been fixed now, at least it worked for me.

reviewText:
I played a lot of simulators lately, so I was looking for something rural – my decision: Professional Farmer 2017. I love the details in the game, indie games always relay on details. Details like the different animations while driving on your field or painting your machines are very cool. This game has got a lot of it, they graphics work very well. A big plus is the controller support and graphics are very good for an indie production. The world pretty big, there are a lot of places you can work on.
You have a lot of different things to do, you can word on field and do a whole agricultural stuff. Driving with tractor and do all the work that needs to be done. There a tutorial, to learn the basics and afterwards you can hop into the career mode.
The other part is breeding, a lot of different animals are available. All the stuff is not just for fun, you have to manage a budget and plan ahead and you also have to buy new fields, crops, machines and animals. It’s not just planting and harvesting, you have to furrow the field and to fertilize it.
There are some things to polish, like the tractor drives way to fast on the field. But that’s just a little problem. All in all the game works very well and when you are looking for a Farming Simulator, with breeding and economy you have it here! It’s a very nice indie game!

reviewText:
This game very very fun, I love playing games like this because they are relaxing, and very enjoyable with no goal. Controls are responsive, vehicles don't feel jerky. Game looks pretty good, and runs pretty good on old hardware. I'm most likely going to log a bunch more hours on this game. Started a dope farm and I'm making tons of cash now.

Professional Farmer 2017, is awesome if you like open world simulator games where you farm your life away. This is your game. I might have just over 3 hours in it but I'm going to be logging so much more time into this game because its very fun.

It also looks like they fixed the bugs others have reported on, and at least it has been working fine for me.

reviewText:
DescriptionProfessional Farmer 2017 is a simulator game that allows you to become a farmer and plant crops as one. You can use all kinds of tools and vehicles to accomplish this while being able to tend to animals aswell. The game includes different seasons and weather conditions to mix it up.

Pros:   Decent graphics for an early-access title
Helpful tutorial to expand your knowledge on the game
Easy to understand
Feels pretty good and relaxing to farm
Gave me the farmer feeling
An easy game to run on rigs
Neutral:   There isn't any set goals, for now you have to come up with your own
ConclusionOverall, I would recommend this game to any fans that enjoy farming and getting the experience through a simulator. With the big open world that is offered, there is much to accomplish while you grow your crops and tend to your animals. I only spent over an hour with this game but, I have to say it has been interesting so far. This game does show to have poetential and I can only see it getting better in the future.

reviewText: Hmmm where to start, decent concept but poorly implimented. Tractor rock back and forth like a baby carriage, impliments and loaded trailers have no effect on tractor performance at all. Field work is done at like 30 km /hr as there is no speed control or cruise control. Tractors accelerate like a high end sports car . turning takes way big of radius espically gor a farm tractor designed to turn sharp for a reason.No wheel support at all , Never in my life have a saw a combine unload over a pit without extending its auger , must have some new  protoye bottom dump hopper i guess. Can not unhook from the impliments in the tutorial unless your on the arrows in front of the next piece of equipment you need , obviously that was not tested thoroughly. Overall i would say a at bet a 3 out of 10 , that may change if they actually patch and support the game but UIG's track record  seems to say thats a very remote possibilty  but hopefully im wrong. Still have another 40 min of game time before the refund option expires , if they can patch or update it before the two week window  passes I will try it again and see if my opinion changes if not ill get a refund. reviewText:
Professional Farmer 2017 is a great game where you take control over your own farm, in a enjoyable but yet challenging experience. There are tons of different modes and tasks to play with, in a environment that is graphically very well achieved. Honestly I haven’t played a game like this in a long while.

You will get a tutorial to start with which is very straight to the point and explains the most important features of the game. You have 4 enormous areas to work and explore, while tending to your animals, crops or doing many other farm related activities, keeping a eye at the economic side of the simulator genre. Weather also plays a role in Professional Farmer 2017, has some features are season oriented.

The gameplay and controls are very user friendly and self-explanatory at most cases. The soundtrack is also very pleasant, providing the right mood for the game. I was impressed to learn that this is a indie game, and after a check-up I see developers are also very active on providing updates and bug fixes.

If you are looking for a simulator/farming game, this one is the right option for you.
Just go for it.
voteText: 3 of 7 people (43%) found this review helpful 2 people found this review funny

reviewText:
Professional Farmer 2017 it's a really nice simulator, I've spended 8+ hour of gameplay to test the game in order to write this review.
After starting the game and entering the game, we are immediately immersed in the life of the farmer.
The farmer work is realistic, thanks to immersivity that the game offers with its possibilities.
You can see immediately that the game is extremely free. You have an initial budget to buy everything that you can need.
They will be available from the start different veichle and tools (well explained in the tutorial), and you should buy at least one of the 20 terrenti purchased to start growing.
You can purchase all you need in the nearby town, like seed and fertilizers, absolutely necessary for your first planting.
After a few hours of play you can make your completely independent farm, and start earning your first money.

Pros
Relaxing
Tractor personalization
Multilanguage
Good Keyboard and Controller support
Great and complete tutorial, in a few minutes you will know all you need
The game is absolutely recommended to all who like the genre
